Similarly, the film "The Babadook" challenges traditional gender roles by portraying the female protagonist Amelia as a single mother who takes on the role of protector and defender for her son.

However, it's important to note that not all horror films challenge gender roles in this way. Many horror films still rely on traditional gender roles to create tension and suspense, with women portrayed as vulnerable and in need of protection.
